ABAT.overview: Battery Same Unit Repair in Store through GSX

ASCR.overview: Display Same Unit Repair in Store through GSX

AREC.overview: Receiver Same Unit Repair in Store through GSX

ASPK.overview: Speaker Same Unit Repair in Store through GSX

AVIB.overview: Vibe Motor Same Unit Repair in Store through GSX

ACAM.overview: Camera Same Unit Repair in Store through GSX

ARDO.overview: Repair Redo on Same Unit Repair

ALON**.overview: Apple Loaner assigned to a client through GSX

AFAL.overview: Whole Unit Replacement after failed Same Unit Repair

AMAL.overview: Mail in Repair shipped to Apple through GSX

ACON*.overview: Apple Consultation, the client device must be present

SFRN.overview: Screen replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir

SBAK.overview: Back glass/cover replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update and repair validation using Fenrir

SFBR.overview: Screen and back glass/cover replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update and repair validation using Fenrir

SFCR.overview: Front Screen and component replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update and repair validation using Fenrir

SBCR.overview: Back glass/cover and component replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SFBC.overview: Front screen, back glass/cover and component replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SBAT.overview: Battery replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SCAM.overview: Camera replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SSPK.overview: Speaker replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SBUT.overview: Button replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SAUD.overview: Audio Jack replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SVIB.overview: Vibration Motor replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SREC.overview: Receiver replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SCMP.overview: Component (not listed) replacement, Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC, software update, and repair validation using Fenrir.

SSFT.overview: Software repair/update/installation and Galaxy Diagnostics IQC. Galaxy Diagnostics OQC and Fenrir may be used.

SOSE.overview: Galaxy Diagnostics IQC and On-Site Exchange are performed.

SBER.overview: The device is designated as beyond economical repair during repair inspection. Galaxy Diagnostics IQC & OQC may be used to determine BER.

SNFF.overview: The device is showing no signs of issue after performing Galaxy Diagnostics IQC and agent troubleshooting.

SACC.overview: An accessory is replaced using GSPN.

SRDO.overview: An additional attempt to repair a device is necessary after repair.
SRDO.compatible: This resolution code can be used with any Samsung ASP repair resolution code.

SCON.overview: Client education to review the basic functions of a Samsung device.

GSIS.sku: Standard Problem Code for all Precinct Service and Repairs

GSDC.overview: Install battery, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSDI.overview: Diagnostic completed by Precinct with an operating system repair completed through remote connection

GSHD.overview: Install hard drive, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSHW.overview: Install miscellaneous internal parts, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSMM.overview: Install unlimited memory to one device and test the device

GSMO.overview: Install modem, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSNW.overview: Install network card, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSOD.overview: Install ODD, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSOI.overview: Install one operating system, drivers, critical updates, MFG Software (for restore), and test OS

GSOS.overview: Operating System Repair completed through remote connection (BOP time allotted for connecting and post-op)
GSOS.compatible: GSOI or Any Standalone Resolution Code

GSPR.overview: Install printer/scanner, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSPS.overview: Install power supply, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSPU.overview: Install CPU, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSSB.overview: Install system board, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSSC.overview: Install the sound card, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSSW.overview: The software installs are completed through a remote connection with an operating system repair

GSPW.overview: Remove the Password from Macbook or Windows computer, and assist Client with setting a new password if desired

GSVC.overview: Install video card, install included SW/drivers, update device/drivers, and test

GSHH.overview: Minor repair that does not fall under the additional scope of work and fits into a 15-minute timeframe

GSCS.overview: Register, create accounts, Customizer, Windows update, install security software, and pin tiles. New devices and Open Box purchases only
GSCS.compatible: May only be used with GSSW, GSDB, GSMM, and GSHD

GSDS.overview: Perform "OOBE", install firmware updates, set up accounts, and educate client. New devices and Open Box purchases only.

GSFM.overview: Create restore discs or USB drives. Includes Geek Squad 32GB flash drive

GSSH.overview: Install a screen shield on one mobile phone or one handheld gaming device

GSDB.description: Data Backup or Transfer & Hard Drive
GSDB.overview: Transfer data to another media/device, import data, and configure external HDD. (Includes qualifying hard drive)

None.overview: Shipping and receiving products through Nova

GSRD.overview: Recover Deleted Data from hard drives or memory cards. Not to be used for failing hard drives. (Estimate fee additional)

GSSF.overview: Assist Client with Express Replacement through the Agent Portal

GSOB.overview: Used for items all open item Nova Tags.

GS30.overview: 30 Minute Paid Tutorial with Client, service order needs to be created. (Ring SKU once per 30-minute tutorial)

GS60.overview: 60 Minute Paid Tutorial with Client, service order needs to be created. (Ring SKU 8899138 twice)

GSCO.overview: Standalone consultation at the counter, service order needs to be created

QUIT.description: No work done / No revenue expected.
QUIT.overview: Used when no service is performed and no revenue is expected
